calls.name: LinkPSNAccount
calls.summary: Links the PlayStation Network account associated with the provided access code to the user's PlayFab account

calls.name: LinkServerCustomId
calls.summary: Links the custom server identifier, generated by the title, to the user's PlayFab account.

calls.name: LinkXboxAccount
calls.summary: Links the Xbox Live account associated with the provided access code to the user's PlayFab account

calls.name: LogEvent
calls.summary: Logs a custom analytics event
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to track analytics events. Events logged using this API will be stored in the title's Redshift database. Each unique eventName will create a distinct table within the database. Within that table, a column will be created for every unique key. Using a first-person shooter as an example, the title may need to track headshots as a distinct event. The sample request below demonstrates an example of this. In addition to the values sent, timestamps and User IDs are automatically added as 'ts' and 'user_id' to each table. The 'Headshot' table in this example would then have the schema: 'user_id'|'ts'|'victim'|'gun'|'x_coord'|'y_coord'|'z_coord'|'damage|aim_assist' and the row corresponding to this event would look like: 'EF987654ABAB012'|'2014-1-1 12:12:12'|'B76543AEAE65'|'big_bad_sniper'|10|20|1|1000|1.The PlayFab service automatically creates events for all login and purchase operations. This API is intended for game specific events only. Please note that event logging is not enabled for titles by default. If you need event logging enabled, please contact us at helloplayfab@microsoft.com for more information.

calls.name: LoginWithServerCustomId
calls.summary: Securely login a game client from an external server backend using a custom identifier for that player. Server Custom ID and Client Custom ID are mutually exclusive and cannot be used to retrieve the same player account.

calls.name: LoginWithXbox
calls.summary: Signs the user in using a Xbox Live Token from an external server backend, returning a session identifier that can subsequently be used for API calls which require an authenticated user
calls.requestDetails: If this is the first time a user has signed in with the Xbox Live account and CreateAccount is set to true, a new PlayFab account will be created and linked to the Xbox Live account. In this case, no email or username will be associated with the PlayFab account. Otherwise, if no PlayFab account is linked to the Xbox Live account, an error indicating this will be returned, so that the title can guide the user through creation of a PlayFab account.

calls.name: LoginWithXboxId
calls.summary: Signs the user in using an Xbox ID and Sandbox ID, returning a session identifier that can subsequently be used for API calls which require an authenticated user
calls.requestDetails: If this is the first time a user has signed in with the Xbox ID and CreateAccount is set to true, a new PlayFab account will be created and linked to the Xbox Live account. In this case, no email or username will be associated with the PlayFab account. Otherwise, if no PlayFab account is linked to the Xbox Live account, an error indicating this will be returned, so that the title can guide the user through creation of a PlayFab account.

calls.name: ModifyItemUses
calls.summary: Modifies the number of remaining uses of a player's inventory item
calls.requestDetails: This function can both add and remove uses of an inventory item. If the number of uses drops below zero, the item will be removed from active inventory.

calls.name: MoveItemToCharacterFromCharacter
calls.summary: Moves an item from a character's inventory into another of the users's character's inventory.
calls.requestDetails: Transfers an item from a character to another character that is owned by the same user. This will remove the item from the character's inventory (until and unless it is moved back), and will enable the other character to make use of the item instead.

calls.name: MoveItemToCharacterFromUser
calls.summary: Moves an item from a user's inventory into their character's inventory.
calls.requestDetails: Transfers an item from a user to a character she owns. This will remove the item from the user's inventory (until and unless it is moved back), and will enable the character to make use of the item instead.

calls.name: MoveItemToUserFromCharacter
calls.summary: Moves an item from a character's inventory into the owning user's inventory.
calls.requestDetails: Transfers an item from a character to the owning user. This will remove the item from the character's inventory (until and unless it is moved back), and will enable the user to make use of the item instead.

calls.name: NotifyMatchmakerPlayerLeft
calls.summary: Informs the PlayFab match-making service that the user specified has left the Game Server Instance

calls.name: RedeemCoupon
calls.summary: Adds the virtual goods associated with the coupon to the user's inventory. Coupons can be generated via the Economy->Catalogs tab in the PlayFab Game Manager.
calls.requestDetails: Coupon codes can be created for any item, or set of items, in the catalog for the title. This operation causes the coupon to be consumed, and the specific items to be awarded to the user. Attempting to re-use an already consumed code, or a code which has not yet been created in the service, will result in an error.

calls.name: RedeemMatchmakerTicket
calls.summary: Validates a Game Server session ticket and returns details about the user
calls.requestDetails: This function is used by a Game Server Instance to validate with the PlayFab service that a user has been registered as connected to the server. The Ticket is provided to the client either as a result of a call to StartGame or Matchmake, each of which return a Ticket specific to the Game Server Instance. This function will fail in any case where the Ticket presented is not valid for the specific Game Server Instance making the call. Note that data returned may be Personally Identifying Information (PII), such as email address, and so care should be taken in how this data is stored and managed. Since this call will always return the relevant information for users who have accessed the title, the recommendation is to not store this data locally.

calls.name: RefreshGameServerInstanceHeartbeat
calls.summary: Set the state of the indicated Game Server Instance. Also update the heartbeat for the instance.

calls.name: RegisterGame
calls.summary: Inform the matchmaker that a new Game Server Instance is added.

calls.name: RemoveFriend
calls.summary: Removes the specified friend from the the user's friend list

calls.name: RemoveGenericID
calls.summary: Removes the specified generic service identifier from the player's PlayFab account.

calls.name: RemovePlayerTag
calls.summary: Remove a given tag from a player profile. The tag's namespace is automatically generated based on the source of the tag.
calls.requestDetails: This API will trigger a player_tag_removed event and remove a tag with the given TagName and PlayFabID from the corresponding player profile. TagName can be used for segmentation and it is limited to 256 characters

calls.name: RemoveSharedGroupMembers
calls.summary: Removes users from the set of those able to update the shared data and the set of users in the group. Only users in the group can remove members. If as a result of the call, zero users remain with access, the group and its associated data will be deleted. Shared Groups are designed for sharing data between a very small number of players, please see our guide: https://docs.microsoft.com/gaming/playfab/features/social/groups/using-shared-group-data

calls.name: ReportPlayer
calls.summary: Submit a report about a player (due to bad bahavior, etc.) on behalf of another player, so that customer service representatives for the title can take action concerning potentially toxic players.
calls.resultDetails: Players are currently limited to five reports per day. Attempts by a single user account to submit reports beyond five will result in Updated being returned as false.

calls.name: RevokeAllBansForUser
calls.summary: Revoke all active bans for a user.
calls.requestDetails: Setting the active state of all non-expired bans for a user to Inactive. Expired bans with an Active state will be ignored, however. Returns information about applied updates only.

calls.name: RevokeBans
calls.summary: Revoke all active bans specified with BanId.
calls.requestDetails: Setting the active state of all bans requested to Inactive regardless of whether that ban has already expired. BanIds that do not exist will be skipped. Returns information about applied updates only.

calls.name: RevokeInventoryItem
calls.summary: Revokes access to an item in a user's inventory
calls.requestDetails: In cases where the inventory item in question is a "crate", and the items it contained have already been dispensed, this will not revoke access or otherwise remove the items which were dispensed.

calls.name: RevokeInventoryItems
calls.summary: Revokes access for up to 25 items across multiple users and characters.
calls.requestDetails: In cases where the inventory item in question is a "crate", and the items it contained have already been dispensed, this will not revoke access or otherwise remove the items which were dispensed.

calls.name: SavePushNotificationTemplate
calls.summary: Saves push notification template for title

calls.name: SendCustomAccountRecoveryEmail
calls.summary: Forces an email to be sent to the registered contact email address for the user's account based on an account recovery email template
calls.requestDetails: PlayFab accounts which have valid email address or username will be able to receive a password reset email using this API.The email sent must be an account recovery email template. The username or email can be passed in to send the email

calls.name: SendEmailFromTemplate
calls.summary: Sends an email based on an email template to a player's contact email
calls.requestDetails: Sends an email for only players that have contact emails associated with them. Takes in an email template ID specifyingthe email template to send.

calls.name: SendPushNotification
calls.summary: Sends an iOS/Android Push Notification to a specific user, if that user's device has been configured for Push Notifications in PlayFab. If a user has linked both Android and iOS devices, both will be notified.

calls.name: SendPushNotificationFromTemplate
calls.summary: Sends an iOS/Android Push Notification template to a specific user, if that user's device has been configured for Push Notifications in PlayFab. If a user has linked both Android and iOS devices, both will be notified.

calls.name: SetFriendTags
calls.summary: Updates the tag list for a specified user in the friend list of another user
calls.requestDetails: This operation is not additive. It will completely replace the tag list for the specified user. Please note that only users in the PlayFab friends list can be assigned tags. Attempting to set a tag on a friend only included in the friends list from a social site integration (such as Facebook or Steam) will return the AccountNotFound error.

calls.name: SetGameServerInstanceData
calls.summary: Sets the custom data of the indicated Game Server Instance

calls.name: SetGameServerInstanceState
calls.summary: Set the state of the indicated Game Server Instance.

calls.name: SetGameServerInstanceTags
calls.summary: Set custom tags for the specified Game Server Instance

calls.name: SetPlayerSecret
calls.summary: Sets the player's secret if it is not already set. Player secrets are used to sign API requests. To reset a player's secret use the Admin or Server API method SetPlayerSecret.
calls.requestDetails: APIs that require signatures require that the player have a configured Player Secret Key that is used to sign all requests. Players that don't have a secret will be blocked from making API calls until it is configured. To create a signature header add a SHA256 hashed string containing UTF8 encoded JSON body as it will be sent to the server, the current time in UTC formatted to ISO 8601, and the players secret formatted as 'body.date.secret'. Place the resulting hash into the header X-PlayFab-Signature, along with a header X-PlayFab-Timestamp of the same UTC timestamp used in the signature.

calls.name: SetPublisherData
calls.summary: Updates the key-value store of custom publisher settings
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to store publisher-specific values which can be read, but not written to, by the client. This data is shared across all titles assigned to a particular publisher, and can be used for cross-game coordination. Only titles assigned to a publisher can use this API. This operation is additive. If a Key does not exist in the current dataset, it will be added with the specified Value. If it already exists, the Value for that key will be overwritten with the new Value. For more information email helloplayfab@microsoft.com

calls.name: SetTitleData
calls.summary: Updates the key-value store of custom title settings
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to store title specific values which can be read, but not written to, by the client. For example, a developer could choose to store values which modify the user experience, such as enemy spawn rates, weapon strengths, movement speeds, etc. This allows a developer to update the title without the need to create, test, and ship a new build. This operation is additive. If a Key does not exist in the current dataset, it will be added with the specified Value. If it already exists, the Value for that key will be overwritten with the new Value.

calls.name: SetTitleInternalData
calls.summary: Updates the key-value store of custom title settings
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to store title specific values which are accessible only to the server. This can be used to tweak settings on game servers and Cloud Scripts without needed to update and re-deploy them. This operation is additive. If a Key does not exist in the current dataset, it will be added with the specified Value. If it already exists, the Value for that key will be overwritten with the new Value.

calls.name: SubtractCharacterVirtualCurrency
calls.summary: Decrements the character's balance of the specified virtual currency by the stated amount. It is possible to make a VC balance negative with this API.

calls.name: SubtractUserVirtualCurrency
calls.summary: Decrements the user's balance of the specified virtual currency by the stated amount. It is possible to make a VC balance negative with this API.

calls.name: UnlinkPSNAccount
calls.summary: Unlinks the related PSN account from the user's PlayFab account

calls.name: UnlinkServerCustomId
calls.summary: Unlinks the custom server identifier from the user's PlayFab account.

calls.name: UnlinkXboxAccount
calls.summary: Unlinks the related Xbox Live account from the user's PlayFab account

calls.name: UnlockContainerInstance
calls.summary: Opens a specific container (ContainerItemInstanceId), with a specific key (KeyItemInstanceId, when required), and returns the contents of the opened container. If the container (and key when relevant) are consumable (RemainingUses > 0), their RemainingUses will be decremented, consistent with the operation of ConsumeItem.
calls.requestDetails: Specify the container and optionally the catalogVersion for the container to open
calls.resultDetails: The items and vc found within the container. These will be added and stacked in your inventory as appropriate.

calls.name: UnlockContainerItem
calls.summary: Searches Player or Character inventory for any ItemInstance matching the given CatalogItemId, if necessary unlocks it using any appropriate key, and returns the contents of the opened container. If the container (and key when relevant) are consumable (RemainingUses > 0), their RemainingUses will be decremented, consistent with the operation of ConsumeItem.
calls.requestDetails: Specify the type of container to open and optionally the catalogVersion for the container to open
calls.resultDetails: The items and vc found within the container. These will be added and stacked in your inventory as appropriate.

calls.name: UpdateAvatarUrl
calls.summary: Update the avatar URL of the specified player

calls.name: UpdateBans
calls.summary: Updates information of a list of existing bans specified with Ban Ids.
calls.requestDetails: For each ban, only updates the values that are set. Leave any value to null for no change. If a ban could not be found, the rest are still applied. Returns information about applied updates only.

calls.name: UpdateCharacterData
calls.summary: Updates the title-specific custom data for the user's character which is readable and writable by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, while keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateCharacterInternalData
calls.summary: Updates the title-specific custom data for the user's character which cannot be accessed by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateCharacterReadOnlyData
calls.summary: Updates the title-specific custom data for the user's character which can only be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateCharacterStatistics
calls.summary: Updates the values of the specified title-specific statistics for the specific character
calls.requestDetails: Character statistics are similar to user statistics in that they are numeric values which may only be updated by a server operation, in order to minimize the opportunity for unauthorized changes. In addition to being available for use by the title, the statistics are used for all leaderboard operations in PlayFab.

calls.name: UpdatePlayerStatistics
calls.summary: Updates the values of the specified title-specific statistics for the user
calls.requestDetails: This operation is additive. Statistics not currently defined will be added, while those already defined will be updated with the given values. All other user statistics will remain unchanged.

calls.name: UpdateSharedGroupData
calls.summary: Adds, updates, and removes data keys for a shared group object. If the permission is set to Public, all fields updated or added in this call will be readable by users not in the group. By default, data permissions are set to Private. Regardless of the permission setting, only members of the group (and the server) can update the data. Shared Groups are designed for sharing data between a very small number of players, please see our guide: https://docs.microsoft.com/gaming/playfab/features/social/groups/using-shared-group-data
calls.requestDetails: Note that in the case of multiple calls to write to the same shared group data keys, the last write received by the PlayFab service will determine the value available to subsequent read operations. For scenarios requiring coordination of data updates, it is recommended that titles make use of user data with read permission set to public, or a combination of user data and shared group data.

calls.name: UpdateUserData
calls.summary: Updates the title-specific custom data for the user which is readable and writable by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, while keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserInternalData
calls.summary: Updates the title-specific custom data for the user which cannot be accessed by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserInventoryItemCustomData
calls.summary: Updates the key-value pair data tagged to the specified item, which is read-only from the client.
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the item instance which belongs to the specified user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, while keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserPublisherData
calls.summary: Updates the publisher-specific custom data for the user which is readable and writable by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, while keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserPublisherInternalData
calls.summary: Updates the publisher-specific custom data for the user which cannot be accessed by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserPublisherReadOnlyData
calls.summary: Updates the publisher-specific custom data for the user which can only be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserReadOnlyData
calls.summary: Updates the title-specific custom data for the user which can only be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserStatistics
calls.summary: Updates the values of the specified title-specific statistics for the user. By default, clients are not permitted to update statistics. Developers may override this setting in the Game Manager > Settings > API Features.
calls.requestDetails: This operation is additive. Statistics not currently defined will be added, while those already defined will be updated with the given values. All other user statistics will remain unchanged. Note: For statistics configured to reset on an interval, this API call updates the current (latest) version of the player's statistic. Titles using statistic versioning for resettable leaderboards should make use of the UpdatePlayerStatistics call instead, to ensure that the proper version is updated.
calls.resultDetails: In addition to being available for use by the title, the statistics are used for all leaderboard operations in PlayFab.

calls.name: WriteCharacterEvent
calls.summary: Writes a character-based event into PlayStream.
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to write a multitude of different event types into PlayStream. It supports a flexible JSON schema, which allowsfor arbitrary key-value pairs to describe any character-based event. The created event will be locked to the authenticated title.

calls.name: WritePlayerEvent
calls.summary: Writes a player-based event into PlayStream.
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to write a multitude of different event types into PlayStream. It supports a flexible JSON schema, which allowsfor arbitrary key-value pairs to describe any player-based event. The created event will be locked to the authenticated title.

calls.name: WriteTitleEvent
calls.summary: Writes a title-based event into PlayStream.
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to write a multitude of different event types into PlayStream. It supports a flexible JSON schema, which allowsfor arbitrary key-value pairs to describe any title-based event. The created event will be locked to the authenticated title.
